meanings.definition: A person who inherits jointly with another or others.
meanings.sent1: As a coheir, she shared the inheritance with her siblings.
meanings.sent2: The siblings became coheirs after their parents passed away.
meanings.sent3: The coheir found out they inherited a haunted house - what a surprise!
meanings.sent4: Being a coheir felt like being part of a big family puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The coheir eagerly awaited the reading of the will to learn their fate.

meanings.definition: To inherit jointly with another or others.
meanings.sent1: They decided to coheir the estate to honor their grandfather's wishes.
meanings.sent2: The siblings coheir the property after their aunt's passing.
meanings.sent3: The family agreed to coheir the antique collection to preserve it together.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of unity when they coheired the valuable paintings.
meanings.sent5: The decision to coheir the business brought them closer as a family.
